intro: Micranthes franciscana, commonly known as the Franciscan micranthus, is a rare flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as along stream banks or in riparian habitats. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
